concurrencytest

Class ThreadPoolTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • concurrencytest.ThreadPoolTest

  • public class ThreadPoolTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the ThreadPoolTest. The class actually tests if the the tasks are performed, not if the actions are sped up.
    Since:
    7-8-2014
    Version:
    7-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    ThreadPool

      • testLoadImages

        public final void testLoadImages()
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Tests if the 4 images is loaded within 10 seconds. That is the 4 images are loaded on the pool in less than 1/100th of a second. The test waits for all to finish execution to see if they do. The test simply tests if the images are equal to null. If the loading doesn't happen the images should be null.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - If a method throws an Exception.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If a thread in the pool is interrupted

      • testAddTask

        public void testAddTask()
        Tests the task to be added is executed. This method involves taking a while loop to wait for the runnable to finish execution.

      • testAddTaskWithReflection

        public void testAddTaskWithReflection()
                               throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                      java.lang.SecurityException,
                                      java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                      java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Adds a task to the queue.

        java.lang.InterruptedException - If a thread is interrupted.
